channel.title: Barter or Money?
channel.description:
Barter or Money? What would you rather have? For the numnuts: Bartering is more or less trading stuff for other stuff. Everyone gets what they want with no screwups. There is no set currency.
Example, if you want to barter for a Pie, you may offer a chunk of meat, however, offering a sword or such would not be of much use to the other person. They could then trade the sword on for a whole cow if they are lucky. Hence getting 200 pies out of 1.
Pros: Bartering may get you a lot more than you bargained for. Cons: It may go bad and you loose lots.
Money is more or less a means of trading one object for another (set) object, which has the same value to all people.
Example, if you want to buy a pie, you go into a store and hand over $2 or something. The other person can then buy more materials for making pies. Hence limiting them to about 3 new pies to each one sold.
Pros: Money is not dodgy. Cons: Money isn't really going to get you much return.
So, what do you guys think?
I would more or less go with bartering, it's more fun. :D

item.title: Barter or Money?
item.dc:creator: @wow_raped_XD wow_raped XD
item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:7, topic:229201”][quote author=magma link=topic=301486.msg2420256#msg2420256 date=1220299928]

  • he might want the icecream for his lunch and not when you want the game.
    [/quote]

It’s called a freezer.[/quote]
How would he get this freezer though? He can’t buy anything, he would have to trade what the person WANTS. Barter is gay imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Barter or Money?
item.dc:creator: @wow_raped_XD wow_raped XD
item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

LOL
runescape written all over again

TBH I would like to just have money. You want a video game but you have only 4 pies to trade 4 it, but he dosen’t want pies, he wants ice cream… wtf are you suppose to do then hmm?

item.title: Barter or Money?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Using money is the modern way of bartering. You do realize that if everyone goes back to bartering, you also lose big company’s that produce chemical things. I don’t see a company that produces toxic or explosive products give their products to their employees so they can trade them.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Why dont you just got to non-retail chain shops and haggle?

Money, in todays world it is more fair. Who the hell trades swords for pies?

item.title: Barter or Money?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Barter or Money?
What would you rather have?
For the numnuts:
Bartering is more or less trading stuff for other stuff. Everyone gets what they want with no screwups. There is no set currency.

Example, if you want to barter for a Pie, you may offer a chunk of meat, however, offering a sword or such would not be of much use to the other person. They could then trade the sword on for a whole cow if they are lucky. Hence getting 200 pies out of 1.

Pros: Bartering may get you a lot more than you bargained for.
Cons: It may go bad and you loose lots.

Money is more or less a means of trading one object for another (set) object, which has the same value to all people.

Example, if you want to buy a pie, you go into a store and hand over $2 or something. The other person can then buy more materials for making pies. Hence limiting them to about 3 new pies to each one sold.

Pros: Money is not dodgy.
Cons: Money isn’t really going to get you much return.

So, what do you guys think?

I would more or less go with bartering, it’s more fun.
